p:
In order to further investigate the oxidation state of Eu element, the XPS pattern of Eu3d for the sample obtained at 1400 °C is monitored and shown in Fig. 4. The peaks located at 1165 eV and 1135 eV are corresponded to Eu 3+ oxidation state, but the peaks around 1155 eV and 1125 eV are attributed to Eu 2+ oxidation state [ 11, 36]. This result shows that some of the Eu 3+ ions are reduced to Eu 2+ ions in the zeolite host under high-thermal treatment reaction, and this result is consistent with the PL spectra (Fig. 3). The possible reaction mechanism may be shown in the following equations:
